trans-unit.source: Provides an implementation of <xref:System.IAsyncResult> for use by XML Web service proxies to implement the standard asynchronous method pattern.
Cancels an asynchronous XML Web service request.
Gets the object provided in the last parameter to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Begin" name="Begin" href=""></xref> method asynchronous call.
The <xref:System.Object> provided in the last parameter to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Begin" name="Begin" href=""></xref> method call.
Gets a <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> that is used to wait for an asynchronous operation to complete.

The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> can be used to perform a <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitOne%2A>, <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A>, or <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> to wait for the asynchronous call to complete.
A <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> that is used to wait for an asynchronous operation to complete.
Gets a value indicating whether the Begin call completed synchronously.

If CompletedSynchronously is set to `true` within the <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate, it is probable that the thread that called <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHttpClientProtocol.BeginInvoke%2A> is the current thread.

In this case, you should be careful about making another asynchronous Begin call from the callback method, since it can cause the stack to grow without bound if the calls continue to complete synchronously.
Instead, the call should be completed at the original call site, outside the callback method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Begin call completed synchronously; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the asynchronous XML Web service request has completed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the asynchronous XML Web service request has completed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
